item.title: 尽管经济不景气，中国 6 月工业利润仍实现较快增长
item.description: 周六的官方数据显示，中国 6 月份的工业利润增速加快，尽管在经济复苏不稳的情况下，企业仍在努力应对消费者情绪的下滑。【原文：China's industrial profits grew at a faster clip in June, official data showed on Saturday, even as businesses were grappling with a downshift in consumers' sentiment amid a shaky economic recovery.】

item.title: 美国工会与苹果公司达成临时劳资协议
item.description: 国际机械师和航空航天工人协会（IAM）零售员工组织联盟（IAM CORE）周五与科技巨头苹果公司就改善工作与生活的平衡、加薪和工作保障等问题达成了临时协议。【原文：The International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers (IAM) Coalition of Organized Retail Employees (IAM CORE) reached a tentative agreement with tech giant Apple on Friday over improvement in work-life balance, pay raises and job security.】

item.title: 小肯尼迪质疑特朗普最近支持加密货币的论调，两人正在争夺选票
item.description: 美国独立总统候选人小罗伯特-肯尼迪（Robert F. Kennedy Jr）周五质疑共和党提名人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）最近支持加密货币的立场，两人正在比特币2024大会上争夺11月选举中加密货币持有者的选票。【原文：Independent U.S. presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr on Friday questioned Republican nominee Donald Trump's recent pro-cryptocurrency stance, as the two vie for votes in November's election from crypto-holders at the Bitcoin 2024 conference.】

item.title: 日经新闻》报道，耶伦称日本解释了 2022 年的外汇干预措施
item.description: 据《日经商业日报》（Nikkei Business daily）周六报道，美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）表示，日本已就其在2022年干预货币市场做出了解释。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said Japan had explained its intervention into the currency market in 2022, the Nikkei Business daily reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 对冲基金关于美国国债发行的研究引发争论
item.description: 对冲基金的一份研究报告称，美国财政部去年通过放缓长期债券销售有效地刺激了经济，该报告在债券市场引发了一场争论，美国财政部也否认了这一说法，称其目的并非如此。【原文：A hedge fund study that said the U.S. Treasury last year effectively provided economic stimulus by moderating long-dated bond sales has sparked a debate in the bond market and a denial from the U.S. Treasury that said it was not aiming for such an effect.】

item.title: 耶伦：新兴市场共同关注中国工厂产能过剩问题
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周五表示，包括一些二十国集团（G20）国家在内的新兴市场与她一样对中国工业产能过剩感到担忧，并应敦促中国政府改变其经济模式。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Friday that emerging markets, including some G20 countries, share her concerns about China's excess industrial capacity and should press Beijing to change its economic model.】

item.title: 20 国集团同意解决超级富豪的税收问题，但论坛尚未做出决定
item.description: 二十国集团（G20）财政领导人周五首次发表联合声明，誓言在对全球最大的财富进行有效征税方面开展合作，但这一声明掩盖了关于推进这一议程的合适论坛的更深分歧。【原文：The first-ever joint declaration by G20 finance leaders vowing to cooperate on effectively taxing the world's largest fortunes on Friday papered over deeper disagreement about the right forum to advance the agenda.】

item.title: 六家银行在纽约就欧洲债券价格操纵诉讼达成和解
item.description: 包括美国银行和花旗集团在内的六家银行同意支付 8000 万美元，以了结纽约的反垄断诉讼，该诉讼指控它们合谋操纵欧洲政府债券的价格。【原文：Six banks including Bank of America and Citigroup agreed to pay $80 million to settle antitrust litigation in New York accusing them of conspiring to rig prices of European government bonds.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，星巴克前首席执行官舒尔茨反对与埃利奥特达成潜在和解
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周五报道，星巴克前首席执行官霍华德-舒尔茨（Howard Schultz）反对该咖啡连锁店与激进投资者埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）之间可能达成的和解。【原文：Former Starbucks chief executive, Howard Schultz, is opposing a potential settlement between the coffee chain and activist investor Elliott Investment Management, the Financial Times reported on Friday.】

item.title: 纳斯达克称第一大股东 Thoma Bravo 将出售价值 28 亿美元的股票
item.description: 纳斯达克周五表示，私募股权公司 Thoma Bravo 将通过二次公开募股出售该交易所运营商的 4160 万股股票。【原文：Nasdaq said on Friday private equity firm Thoma Bravo will sell 41.6 million shares in the exchange operator through a secondary public offering.】

item.title: 纽约证券交易所网站显示，阿克曼的美国潘兴广场公司推迟 IPO
item.description: 纽约证券交易所网站周五发布公告称，亿万富翁比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）管理的基金美国潘兴广场公司（Pershing Square USA）已推迟首次公开募股。【原文：Pershing Square USA, a fund managed by billionaire Bill Ackman, has postponed its initial public offering, according to a notice on the New York Stock Exchange's website on Friday.】

item.title: 密歇根州养老基金进行 660 万美元的比特币 ETF 投资
item.description: 密歇根州退休系统（State Michigan Retirement System）为州政府雇员监管着约 1.439 亿美元的养老基金资产，该系统在周五的一份监管文件中披露，已向 ARK 21Shares 比特币 ETF 投资了 660 万美元。【原文：The State of Michigan Retirement System, which oversees some $143.9 million in pension fund assets for state employees, has invested $6.6 million in the ARK 21Shares Bitcoin ETF , it disclosed in a regulatory filing on Friday.】

item.title: 哈里斯的两位亿万富翁捐款人希望她解雇联邦贸易委员会主席莉娜-汗
item.description: 亿万富翁、民主党捐助者巴里-迪勒（Barry Diller）和里德-霍夫曼（Reid Hoffman）本周在接受采访时表示，他们希望卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）如果成为美国总统，将取代联邦贸易委员会主席莉娜-汗（Lina Khan），公开拒绝乔-拜登（Joe Biden）总统的反垄断政策支柱。【原文：Billionaire Democratic donors Barry Diller and Reid Hoffman said in interviews this week they hope Kamala Harris will replace Federal Trade Commission Chair Lina Khan if she becomes U.S. president, openly rejecting a pillar of President Joe Biden's antitrust policy.】

item.title: 破产的 Steward Health 将关闭两家马萨诸塞州医院
item.description: 破产医院所有者 Steward Health Care 周五表示，由于未能找到买家，该公司将关闭马萨诸塞州的两家医院。【原文：Bankrupt hospital owner Steward Health Care will close two locations in Massachusetts after failing to find a buyer for them, the company said Friday.】

item.title: 耶伦表示，全球税务谈判应留在经合组织，而非联合国
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周五表示，她反对将全球税收协议的谈判从经济合作与发展组织（Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development）转移到联合国，以回击一些发展中国家和非营利组织的愿望。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Friday that she opposes shifting the negotiations for a global tax deal to the United Nations from the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development, pushing back against the desires of some developing countries and non-profit groups.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉债券持有人希望大选前的招募活动能取得成效
item.description: 在委内瑞拉即将于周末举行关键性选举之际，其债券持有人正在进行招募活动，希望这次投票能为世界上最大的债务重组开辟某种途径。【原文：As Venezuela heads for pivotal elections at the weekend, its bondholders are on a recruitment drive in the hope the vote will open up some sort of path to the world's biggest debt restructuring.】

item.title: 独家报道波音公司要求供应商提供长达十年之久的钛金属文件线索，以扩大对赝品的检查范围
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一封信，波音公司正在要求供应商披露自 2014 年以来有关中国钛的记录，因为这家美国飞机制造商正在扩大对用于验证商用喷气机所用金属的虚假文件的检查。【原文：Boeing is asking suppliers to disclose records on Chinese titanium since 2014, according to a letter seen by Reuters, as the U.S. planemaker widens checks for false paperwork used to authenticate the metal used in commercial jets.】

item.title: 巴黎奥运会转播商在人工智能方法上存在分歧
item.description: 巴黎奥运会将向美国观众展示生成式人工智能，但欧洲观众不会看到类似的方式，这种反差反映了全球媒体公司正在如何斟酌这项技术的使用。【原文：The Paris Olympics will be a showcase of generative AI for American viewers but European audiences won't see a similar approach, a contrast that reflects how global media companies are deliberating over the use of the technology.】

item.title: Netflix 前电影主管斯图伯与亚马逊米高梅结盟，重振联艺集团
item.description: 亚马逊米高梅影业公司（Amazon MGM Studios）周五表示，该公司已与 Netflix 前电影部门长期主管斯科特-斯图伯（Scott Stuber）建立了多年的电影合作关系，为他的新制片公司提供资金并发行电影。【原文：Amazon MGM Studios has entered a multi-year film partnership with Scott Stuber, the former longtime head of films at Netflix , to finance and release movies from his new production company, it said on Friday.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟发现公司起诉 NBA 竞购转播权
item.description: 华纳兄弟发现公司及其体育部门特纳广播系统周五在纽约对美国国家篮球协会提起诉讼，原因是联盟拒绝了该公司对媒体转播权的匹配竞标。【原文：Warner Bros Discovery and its sports division, Turner Broadcasting System, filed a lawsuit on Friday against the National Basketball Association in New York over the league's rejection of its matching bid for media rights.】

item.title: 美国法官阻止劳工部最新版信托规则的实施
item.description: 美国一名法官阻止了劳工部一项本可扩大被视为受托人的退休顾问类型的规定生效，认为该规定武断且与管理退休计划的法律相冲突。【原文：A U.S. judge has blocked a Department of Labor rule from taking effect that would have expanded the types of retirement advisers who are considered fiduciaries, finding the rule was arbitrary and conflicted with a law that governs retirement plans.】

item.title: 可能拖垮做空者安德鲁-勒夫的交易
item.description: 美国当局对激进卖空行业的知名人士安德鲁-莱福特（Andrew Left）提出刑事和民事指控，称其多年来一直操纵市场，并在交易中误导投资者。【原文：U.S. authorities filed criminal and civil charges against Andrew Left, a prominent face of the activist short-selling industry, alleging he had for years manipulated the market and defrauded investors with misleading claims about his trades.】

item.title: 贝克休斯认为北美业务量下降，将赌注押在国外需求上
item.description: 贝克休斯周五以北美公司钻井活动减少为由，下调了对石油生产商支出的展望，与其他油田服务公司一道警告该地区经济疲软。【原文：Baker Hughes cut its outlook for spending by oil producers on Friday, citing lower drilling activity by North American companies, joining other oilfield service companies in warning about softness in the region.】

item.title: 消息人士称，亚马逊因逃税在米兰接受第二次调查
item.description: 周五，两位消息人士称，米兰检察官正在对亚马逊的一个意大利部门进行调查，原因是该部门涉嫌逃税。【原文：An Italian unit of Amazon is being investigated by Milan prosecutors for suspected tax evasion, two sources said on Friday, but the inquiry was not linked to a multi-million euro seizure from another of the group's Italian units this week.】

item.title: 丰业银行数千名客户受技术问题影响
item.description: 周五，加拿大丰业银行的数千名客户遇到了技术问题，许多人抱怨工资单丢失和其他问题。【原文：Thousands of Bank of Nova Scotia clients in Canada were experiencing technical issues on Friday, with many complaining about missing paychecks and other problems.】

item.title: 智利科德尔科公司称 2024 年上半年产量下降 8
item.description: 世界最大的铜生产商智利科德尔科公司（Codelco）（COBRE.UL）周五公布，2024 年上半年的产量比去年同期下降了 8.4%，为 579,785 公吨。【原文：Chile's Codelco (COBRE.UL), the world's largest copper producer, on Friday posted a 8.4% drop in output for the first half of 2024 compared with the same period last tear, at 579,785 metric tons.】

item.title: 资深立法者称，YouTube 在俄罗斯速度较慢，谷歌难辞其咎
item.description: 一位与当局关系密切的资深立法者周五表示，由于谷歌未能升级其在俄罗斯的设备并拒绝解封俄罗斯媒体频道，YouTube 在俄罗斯的台式电脑上的运行速度将急剧下降。【原文：YouTube speeds in Russia are set to sharply decline on desktop computers due Google's failure to upgrade its equipment in Russia and its refusal to unblock channels of Russian media, a senior lawmaker close to the authorities said on Friday.】

item.title: Indivior 与美国各州达成 8600 万美元阿片类药物和解协议
item.description: 纽约州总检察长莱蒂西亚-詹姆斯（Letitia James）周五表示，Indivior 公司达成了一项 8600 万美元的和解协议，以解决该公司在全美范围内传播阿片类药物成瘾的问题。【原文：Indivior reached an $86 million settlement to resolve the company's role in spreading opioid addiction across the United States, New York Attorney General Letitia James said on Friday.】

item.title: 白宫表示，苹果公司签署了美国管理人工智能风险的自愿计划
item.description: 白宫周五表示，苹果公司已经签署了美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）关于人工智能（AI）的自愿承诺，与其他15家公司一起承诺确保人工智能的力量不被用于破坏性目的。【原文：Apple Inc has signed U.S. President Joe Biden's voluntary commitments governing artificial intelligence (AI), joining 15 other firms that have committed to ensuring that AI's power is not used for destructive purposes, the White House said on Friday.】

item.title: 微软旗下 LinkedIn 与声称其向广告商多收费的诉讼达成和解
item.description: LinkedIn 同意支付 662.5 万美元，以了结一起集体诉讼，该诉讼指控微软公司通过夸大其平台上视频广告的观看人数，向广告商多收费用。【原文：LinkedIn agreed to pay $6.625 million to settle a proposed class action accusing the Microsoft unit of overcharging advertisers by inflating how many people watched video ads on its platform.】
